revised_title: The Origin of the Ascidian Mouth: A Study of Development and Homologies
tldr: The author investigates the origin of the ascidian mouth and its development in three different genera of tunicates. They discovered that a large part of the epithelium of the oral siphon is derived from the primitive neural tube of the embryo. The study provides a satisfactory explanation of the opening of the neural gland or hypophysis into the oral siphon and discusses the homologies between tunicates, cephalochordates, and vertebrates.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
